meanings.definition: To give someone the right to do or have something.
meanings.sent1: Winning the contest entitles you to a prize.
meanings.sent2: Having a ticket entitles you to enter the event.
meanings.sent3: Being the birthday child entitles you to choose the game we play.
meanings.sent4: Hard work entitles you to success in the long run.
meanings.sent5: Good behavior entitles you to extra playtime.

meanings.definition: To give a title to a book, movie, etc.
meanings.sent1: The author entitles the book with a catchy phrase.
meanings.sent2: The director entitles the film with a mysterious name.
meanings.sent3: The artist entitles the painting with a meaningful title.
meanings.sent4: The poet entitles the poem with a thought-provoking name.
meanings.sent5: The songwriter entitles the song with emotional lyrics.

meanings.definition: To qualify someone for a particular benefit or privilege.
meanings.sent1: Owning a membership card entitles you to discounts.
meanings.sent2: Completing the course entitles you to a certificate.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a costume entitles you to join the parade.
meanings.sent4: Helping out at the event entitles you to a free meal.
meanings.sent5: Donating to the charity entitles you to a thank-you gift.
